org.vanilladb.core.storage.index.btree

Class BTreePage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vanilladb.core.storage.index.btree.BTreePage

  • public class BTreePage
extends Object
    A page corresponding to a single B-tree block in a file for BTreeDir or BTreeLeaf.

    The content of each B-tree block begins with an integer storing the number of index records in that page, then a series of integer flags, followed by a series of slots holding index records. Index records are sorted in ascending order.

        public BTreePage(BlockId blk,
                 int numFlags,
                 Schema schema,
                 Transaction tx)
        Opens a page for the specified B-tree block.
        Parameters:
        blk - a block ID refers to the B-tree block
        numFlags - the number of flags in this b-tree page
        schema - the schema for the particular B-tree file
        tx - the calling transaction

      • insert

        public void insert(int slot)
        Inserts a slot to the current BTreePage. Since this whole action must be done atomically in a buffer, it will lock the flushing mechanism of the buffer to ensure no one can flush during the operation.
        Parameters:
        slot - the id of the slot to be inserted

      • delete

        public void delete(int slot)
        Deletes a slot of the current BTreePage. Since this whole action must be done atomically in a buffer, it will lock the flushing mechanism of the buffer to ensure no one can flush during the operation.
        Parameters:
        slot - the id of the slot to be deleted

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns true if the block is full.
        Returns:
        true if the block is full

        public boolean isGettingFull()
        Returns true if the block is going to be full after insertion.
        Returns:
        true if the block is going to be full after insertion

      • split

        public long split(int splitSlot,
                  long[] flags)
        Splits the page at the specified slot. A new page is created, and the records of the page starting from the split slot are transferred to the new page.
        Parameters:
        splitSlot - the split position
        flags - the flag values
        Returns:
        the number of the new block

      • transferRecords

        public void transferRecords(int start,
                            BTreePage dest,
                            int destStart,
                            int num)
        Transfers num records starting from the start-th records of the current page to the destStart-th slot of the dest page.
        Parameters:
        start - the id of the first record to be transfered in the current page
        dest - the destination page
        destStart - the starting slot of the destination page
        num - the number of records to be transfered
